alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 9:18PM PST until December 28 at 3:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong southwest winds expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Tree branches could fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are expected above 5000 feet through early Sunday morning. Heavy snow and strong southwest winds are possible again Monday and Monday night, with lower snow levels. * WHERE...San Bernardino County and Riverside County Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, through 10 AM Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 2 PM Monday through 3 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds of 20 to 35 mph with gusts 50 to locally 60 mph. Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times in snow, blowing snow and fog. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
